intro: Cyrtandra areolata var. areolata, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and mountainous regions. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
